title: Franctoshi
author: Franctoshi
content: Rumors about the lunch of Trump meme coin, the first meme coin to break a dollar and it hasn't been listed in major exchanges, having some liquidity taking out from Bitcoin into the Meme coin, however I saw the Trump meme coin count down about getting listed in the perpetual contract side on Bybit exchange.People are saying that this lunch was targeted at lunching when the SEC office was closed over the weekend and Gary Gensler is about leaving office, pre-Inaugration.Though there is no clear confirmation about wether this news is official or not. Anyone with insight as regards to this news should throw more lights.https://x.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1880446012168249386?t=H9hkprSmswf5MFwc2WNP0w&s=19

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.created_time: January 18, 2025, 09:39:27 AMLast edit: January 18, 2025, 09:51:27 AM by Apocollapse
comments.body: We can only know if Twitter publicize password, email, cell phone number change to the public, even better if they can show the account was been accessed with unknown IP address.I read on the comments, people are saying it's scam just because one address hold 80% of the token and only 10% allocation to public, I mean how it's matter when the token is already centralized in the first place.Either hacked or not, but this is not good, he was promoting WLFI, now he promote his "own" meme coin, what's next? his face in NFT version?

comments.author: aTriz
comments.body: Quote from: Franctoshi on January 18, 2025, 07:57:59 AMthe first meme coin to break a dollar and it hasn't been listed in major exchanges, No it is not. there has been several other meme-coins with higher than a dollar value,  for example. WIF, PEPECOIN, SPX, and many more. you can check this list: https://coinmarketcap.com/view/memes/the Official Trump memecoin is also in the list. and it is listed in a lot of exchanges already. it is going insane with almost $4 billion marketcap. I wonder where will this end?

comments.author: Rustam Meraj
comments.body: That is new Trump themed meme coin making waves. Although it is not listed on major exchanges yet some investors have already shifted funds from Bitcoin to this meme coin. Bybit exchange has countdown suggesting it will be listed soon. Launch timing has raised suspicions possibly planned during SEC office closure and before Gary Gensler departure but there is no official confirmation. Currently TRUMP trades almost at $20 and market cap of $3.87B which is a huge gain. And in my point of view they are just playing with crypto market. That would be better if he concentrate on Bitcoin other than launching new token.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: Franctoshi on January 18, 2025, 07:57:59 AMRumors about the lunch of Trump meme coin, the first meme coin to break a dollar and it hasn't been listed in major exchanges, having some liquidity taking out from Bitcoin into the Meme coin, however I saw the Trump meme coin count down about getting listed in the perpetual contract side on Bybit exchange.This is meme coin, and it's not Bitcoin.Bitcoin market won't be affected by any meme coin.  Bitcoin actually started its rally before Trump Inaguration Day, and the launch of this meme coin won't help Bitcoin to make its new all time high. It will depend on Trump adminstration and policy on Bitcoin market in particular and blockchain industry in general as well as policy and execution on making Bitcoin as part of the USA. National Strategic Reserve.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Nothing new to see here.Someone who is famousSomeone who is a criminalSomeone who wants to rip people offcreated a completely useless shittoken that has absolutely no utility.People who are gamblersNewbies who don't know any betterDay traders looking for a quick buckbuy that garbage hoping to make some profit. The creator is the one making the actual profit by selling them "dogshit" in a pretty package...None of it new.None of it has anything to do with bitcoin.None of it is sucking any liquidity out of bitcoin market whatsoever.If anything it brings more liquidity to bitcoin because a lot of people who don't know about bitcoin buy that garbage, realize it was garbage all the while they hear about bitcoin that is not like the junk they were sold. So they dump that shittoken and buy bitcoin

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: If I may ask is there any particular use for this coin as Trump memecoin?I think it's important to always launch a coin that will contribute to the overall growth of the nation as a president, and as we know memecoin doesn't always have a usecase or something meaningful to attached with. If Trump could launch memecoin and not a coin to attributes to the overall growth of US is worthless as nothing because I didn't see how this coin has control to even the growth of bitcoin or even influence other altcoin as I may see, people who are investing in this meme are just those who are solely jumping from one memes to another with the purpose of utilizing the quick cash out when there is possible x to achieve from their investment.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Serious investors aren’t buying Trump meme coin, it will probably top out & start dumping by the end of the weekend. These type of launches don’t have sustainability. You are much better off having your money in Bitcoin than anything else.

comments.author: HeRetiK
comments.body: I'm really curious to see if this is "legit" or if he was hacked. Given the timing that this is happening on a weekend I'd assume he was hacked, but on the other hand there hasn't been any statement so far that says otherwise? Neither on Twitter nor Truth Social. (at least from what I've gathered second hand so far, I follow neither platform)Then again it's kinda telling that it's hard to tell.Quote from: Apocollapse on January 18, 2025, 09:39:27 AMEither hacked or not, but this is not good, he was promoting WLFI, now he promote his "own" meme coin, what's next? his face in NFT version?Ummm... you do know that he already did that in 2022, right?

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: HeRetiK on January 18, 2025, 11:55:24 AMI'm really curious to see if this is "legit" or if he was hacked. Given the timing that this is happening on a weekend I'd assume he was hacked, but on the other hand there hasn't been any statement so far that says otherwise? Neither on Twitter nor Truth Social. (at least from what I've gathered second hand so far, I follow neither platform)Then again it's kinda telling that it's hard to tell.I don't worry that it is a hack, because Trump and his team already did it a few times, with NFT collections and similarities.This action is not strange if taking into consideration his past activities releated to cryptocurrencies especially NFTs. With his latest bullish on Bitcoin and cryptocurrency during his Presidential campaign months ago and after he became the President Elect, this latest action does not surprise me too much.I consider it is legit and not a hack from his account on social media, but I don't want to join his funny games like this as it is risky and I can waste and lose my bitcoin by bad decisions.Donald Trump's first NFT collection sells out in less than a day in 2022.Donald Trump Launches 4th NFT Collection Featuring Him Holding Bitcoin in 2024.

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: Franctoshi on January 18, 2025, 07:57:59 AMRumors about the lunch of Trump meme coin, the first meme coin to break a dollar and it hasn't been listed in major exchanges, having some liquidity taking out from Bitcoin into the Meme coin, however I saw the Trump meme coin count down about getting listed in the perpetual contract side on Bybit exchange.Is there any source with this claim? Price of Bitcoin is still strong at 104K which is higher than the previous day which means there’s no selling pressure happening that will transfer liquidity from Bitcoin to this Trump coin.I’m interested to see the data about the marketcap of this Trumpcoin growth in comparison to Bitcoin marketcap decreases since this is the only way to conclude whether Trump coin is sucking liquidity from Bitcoin.

comments.author: HeRetiK
comments.body: Quote from: OcTradism on January 18, 2025, 02:15:48 PMQuote from: HeRetiK on January 18, 2025, 11:55:24 AMI'm really curious to see if this is "legit" or if he was hacked. Given the timing that this is happening on a weekend I'd assume he was hacked, but on the other hand there hasn't been any statement so far that says otherwise? Neither on Twitter nor Truth Social. (at least from what I've gathered second hand so far, I follow neither platform)Then again it's kinda telling that it's hard to tell.I don't worry that it is a hack, because Trump and his team already did it a few times, with NFT collections and similarities.I mean, sure, but it also wouldn't be the first time that Trump's socials have been hacked. Wouldn't even have been the second time. And it wouldn't even have been the first time that one of the Trump family's socials was hacked to pump and dump a random shitcoin.That being said, since there hasn't been any statement otherwise so far, seems like he's indeed done it. Grifters gonna grift.

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: Quote from: Beparanf on January 18, 2025, 02:19:30 PMQuote from: Franctoshi on January 18, 2025, 07:57:59 AMRumors about the lunch of Trump meme coin, the first meme coin to break a dollar and it hasn't been listed in major exchanges, having some liquidity taking out from Bitcoin into the Meme coin, however I saw the Trump meme coin count down about getting listed in the perpetual contract side on Bybit exchange.Is there any source with this claim? Price of Bitcoin is still strong at 104K which is higher than the previous day which means there’s no selling pressure happening that will transfer liquidity from Bitcoin to this Trump coin.I’m interested to see the data about the marketcap of this Trumpcoin growth in comparison to Bitcoin marketcap decreases since this is the only way to conclude whether Trump coin is sucking liquidity from Bitcoin.it doesn't necessarily mean that the Bitcoin price will drop for the liquidity to flow into the Trump Meme coin, rather those liquidities that would have pushed the price of Bitcoin way pass $104k, after that, this news break.However, What this means is that the liquidity which should have been all melt into Bitcoin and pushed the price higher, a bit of the funds has flown into the trending Trump meme coin and no doubt about that. If you can check about the meme coin marketcap, it is now worth about $2B plus marketcap and you know what that amount means.

comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: The fact that this is just a meme coin, its sustainability and its real value in the future remain uncertain. Same goes with all meme coins that were hyped at first but eventually lose its value as time goes by. So as much as I want to learn more about this, however this will never be a threat and would definitely not become a close rival for bitcoin.Bitcoin is bitcoin, meme coins are just internet memes based on the current trend. When the hype and popularity is gone, its value as well comes to an end. Not even sure if it’s still up for months, unlike bitcoin that is already one decade and counting.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: SmartGold01 on January 18, 2025, 11:45:55 AMIf I may ask is there any particular use for this coin as Trump memecoin?The only news about this memecoin is the tweet from Trump official account as we all know this kind of information actually drives people info buying through hype and we all know that this hypes dies down fast after the early adopters have made profits and they take them, if is above 30B Market cap last time I check it will definitely be getting numbers now and the only thing that will stop that will be the inauguration. Once Trump is inaugurated I think many people will definitely opt out. Quote from: pooya87 on January 18, 2025, 11:07:04 AMIf anything it brings more liquidity to bitcoin because a lot of people who don't know about bitcoin buy that garbage, realize it was garbage all the while they hear about bitcoin that is not like the junk they were sold. So they dump that shittoken and buy bitcoin This is the route most people will take by taking profits from the $TRUMP coin and then invest it into something with utility which is bitcoin. No one can actually afford to leave off profit on this coins, memecoins remain memecoins no matter who lunched it. Most of the buyers were those buying with two figure price and not some huge money. So there is no too much liquidity coming in that can move bitcoin.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Trump meme coin have been lunched in exchanges and the hype is really high. When I checked the price this morning, it was $37 but currently it has pumped to $67. This baffles me to see how people are rushing and buying Trump meme coin, because he is already the president of US. It means that this meme coin will keep pumping till Trump leaves office. Will this be another pump and dumb project.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on January 19, 2025, 10:13:27 AMTrump meme coin have been lunched in exchanges and the hype is really high. When I checked the price this morning, it was $37 but currently it has pumped to $67. This baffles me to see how people are rushing and buying Trump meme coin, because he is already the president of US. It means that this meme coin will keep pumping till Trump leaves office. Will this be another pump and dumb project. I also saw it at $37 but today I was surprised that it rose to $67 and then made a big green candle at $98 and suddenly dropped, maybe a whale bought a large amount in a moment.Anyway, the Trump meme craze continues and the coin achieved amazing trading volume on the first day, even achieving a market cap of over 6 billion in the first 12 hours of its launch, the amount of money being pumped into this meme is unreasonable, of course the only reason is that Trump officially adopted it.

comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on January 19, 2025, 10:49:40 AMI also saw it at $37 but today I was surprised that it rose to $67 and then made a big green candle at $98 and suddenly dropped, maybe a whale bought a large amount in a moment.Anyway, the Trump meme craze continues and the coin achieved amazing trading volume on the first day, even achieving a market cap of over 6 billion in the first 12 hours of its launch, the amount of money being pumped into this meme is unreasonable, of course the only reason is that Trump officially adopted it.This market cycle is crazy and unprecedented as it was triggered by Bitcoin, surely it is the first coin to rise, then meme coins. Solana and meme coins have a very bullish cycle but Ethereum and BNB sucks so far, BNB made its new all time high but not too impressive. Ethereum did not make its new all time high in this market cycle.TRUMP crazy rise recent days is another example on this crazy market cycle for meme coins.In long term, meme coins are degen altcoins and people must be very careful with meme coins.The two types of altcoins.Degen altcoins will have similar charts like the following chart.

comments.author: asriloni
comments.body: Whales're sucking liquidity from any of altcoins, then put it all into the Trump coin. All of whales are now fully concentrating on the US based coins.Glad to see they're not pulling out their money from Bitcoin to be invested in Trump coin. It seems the liquidity in Altcoin will be concentrating to the Trump's official meme coin. As long as it's not hurting bitcoin, that's fine.
